config.question: Americans conducted “broken voyages,” which involved sailing out of French ports in the Caribbean and stopping briefly at __________.

answer_3.response: Since the Royal Navy did not allow direct trade between France and its colonies, American captains conducted “broken voyages,” during which American vessels sailing out of French ports in the Caribbean would put in briefly to an American port, pay nominal customs, and then sail to France.
